title: Dirichlet character
summary: In analytic number theory and related branches of mathematics, a complex-valued arithmetic function χ : Z → C {\displaystyle \chi :\mathbb {Z} \rightarrow \mathbb {C} } is a Dirichlet character of modulus m {\displaystyle m} (where m {\displaystyle m} is a positive integer) if for all integers a {\displaystyle a} and b {\displaystyle b} :[1]
